item.title: 巴鲁将与勒庞会面，组建法国政府的努力由此开始
item.description: 法国总理弗朗索瓦-巴伊鲁（Francois Bayrou）将于周一会见极右翼领导人玛丽娜-勒庞（Marine Le Pen），为组建政府以推动预算案通过分裂的议会拉开序幕。【原文：France’s Prime Minister Francois Bayrou will meet with far-right leader Marine Le Pen on Monday, kicking off an effort to form a government that can push a budget through a divided Parliament.】

item.title: 伊朗全力应对冬季寒流带来的燃料短缺问题
item.description: 寒流迫使伊朗大部分地区的学校停课，公共生活也受到其他干扰，因为当局正在努力解决供暖和发电用天然气短缺的问题。【原文：A cold snap has forced school closures and other disruptions to public life across much of Iran, as authorities grapple with a shortage of natural gas for heating and electricity generation.】

item.title: 巨额利息负担困扰着 290 亿美元的新兴债务堆
item.description: 发展中国家的 2025 年已经注定动荡不安，它们不得不为过去十年积累的 29 万亿美元债务支付不断膨胀的利息。【原文：Developing nations, already set for a turbulent 2025, are having to cope with ballooning interest payments on $29 trillion of debt that built up over the last decade.】

item.title: 苹果的计算新愿景是巨型可折叠 iPad
item.description: 苹果公司对未来计算技术的新愿景是推出一款类似 iPad 的巨型可折叠设备。此外：该公司将重新考虑鼠标，其下一款 AirTag 将采用新的芯片，让你能在更远的地方找到物品，而向自制 Wi-Fi 芯片的转变将于明年启动。苹果还计划为其智能手表升级卫星和健康功能。【原文：Apple’s new vision for the future of computing is a giant, iPad-like foldable device. Also: The company rethinks the mouse, its next AirTag will have a new chip that lets you find items from farther away, and a shift to in-house Wi-Fi chips will kick off next year. Apple also is planning satellite and health upgrades for its smartwatch.】

item.title: 波音公司的危机之年让投资者警惕被打压的股票
item.description: 如果华尔街的判断是正确的，那么这家飞机制造商的股价在 2025 年可能只会略有回升。【原文：What was supposed to be a comeback year for Boeing Co. has turned into its worst stock-market plunge since 2008, and if Wall Street is right, the plane-maker’s shares may have only a modest recovery in store in 2025.】

item.title: 加纳当选总统称国际货币基金组织协议将限制激进改革
item.description: 加纳即将上任的总统约翰-马哈马（John Mahama）表示，在选民赋予他解决国家沉重的债务负担和高昂的生活费用的重任一周后，与国际货币基金组织（International Monetary Fund）签订的融资计划将限制加纳政府立即进行大刀阔斧改革的能力。【原文：Ghana’s incoming president John Mahama said a financing program with the International Monetary Fund will limit his government’s ability to undertake immediate radical reforms, a week after voters handed him a hefty mandate to fix the nation’s crippling debt burden and high cost of living.】

item.title: 世界贸易组织（WTO）负责人表示，开放的全球贸易是养活世界的唯一途径
item.description: 世界贸易组织总干事恩古齐-奥孔乔-伊韦拉（Ngozi Okonjo-Iweala）说，如果世界不努力维持一个稳定和开放的贸易体系，全球贫困就会加剧。【原文：Global poverty will increase if the world doesn’t work to maintain a stable and open trading system, World Trade Organization Director General Ngozi Okonjo-Iweala said.】

item.title: BC Partners 接近将 Synthon 出售给高盛资产管理公司
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，BC Partners 即将达成一项交易，将荷兰仿制药制造商 Synthon International Holding BV 出售给高盛资产管理公司。【原文：BC Partners is nearing a deal to sell Dutch generic drugmaker Synthon International Holding BV to Goldman Sachs Asset Management, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 英国央行在经历了利率失利的一年后开始谨慎行事
item.description: 英国央行在进入今年时，投资者预计将有六次降息，这种突然的宽松政策有望为英国经济注入活力。到 2024 年底，英国的借贷成本将比 12 个月前的预测高出整整一个百分点。【原文：The Bank of England entered the year with investors expecting six interest-rate cuts, a sudden easing that promised to breathe life into the UK economy. It will end 2024 holding borrowing costs a full percentage point higher than forecast 12 months ago.】

item.title: 欧洲央行卡扎克警告降息不要太过分
item.description: 欧洲央行理事会成员马丁斯-卡扎克认为，欧洲央行应进一步降低利率，但可能不需要将利率降至可刺激经济扩张的水平。【原文：The European Central Bank should lower interest rates further but probably won’t need to take them to levels that would stimulate economic expansion, according to Governing Council member Martins Kazaks.】

item.title: 阿曼 OQ 甲醇部门在 4.89 亿美元首次公开募股后首次亮相即下跌 10
item.description: OQ Base Industries 在马斯喀特首次公开募股 4.89 亿美元，上市后首次交易即告下跌，这是中东一系列上市企业中早盘交易不佳的最新一家。【原文：OQ Base Industries fell in its trading debut after a $489 million initial public offering in Muscat, the latest in a series of Middle Eastern listings to experience poor early trading.】

item.title: 毛里求斯推广顶级高尔夫球场吸引高端游客
item.description: 长期以来，印度洋上的毛里求斯岛一直是游客们钟爱的旅游胜地，绵延的白沙海滩、蔚蓝的泻湖和珊瑚礁吸引着众多游客。【原文：The Indian Ocean island of Mauritius has long been a beloved destination for tourists drawn to its long stretches of white-sand beaches, blue lagoons and coral reefs.】

item.title: 英国《金融时报》报道：蓝鲸因人工智能成本问题减持科技巨头股份
item.description: 据英国《金融时报》报道，由于担心人工智能的成本，蓝鲸资本（Blue Whale Capital LLP）的一家投资基金减少了其在美国主要科技公司中的股份。【原文：A Blue Whale Capital LLP investment fund reduced its stakes in major US technology companies on concern about the costs of artificial intelligence, the Financial Times reported.】

item.title: 韩国央行誓言在政治动荡中稳定市场
item.description: 韩国央行在其自立法者投票弹劾总统尹锡烈以来的首次声明中誓言稳定金融市场，并强调了 "不间断实施 "关键财政和经济措施的重要性。【原文：South Korea’s central bank vowed to stabilize financial markets and highlighted the importance of “uninterrupted implementation” of key fiscal and economic measures, in its first statement since lawmakers voted to impeach President Yoon Suk Yeol.】

item.title: 报告称中国住房监管机构看到稳定迹象
item.description: 据中国新闻社报道，由于政府采取了刺激措施，中国住房监管机构看到了房地产市场稳定和情绪改善的迹象。【原文：China’s housing regulator is seeing signs of stabilization and improved sentiment in the real estate market as a result of government stimulus measures, China News Service reported.】

item.title: 增长乏力和采矿业放缓给澳大利亚带来压力：查莫斯
item.description: 澳大利亚财政部长吉姆-查默斯（Jim Chalmers）在更新预算之前表示，澳大利亚经济正面临增长疲软、主要矿业出口价值下降以及某些领域需要增加支出等不利因素。【原文：Australia’s economy is facing headwinds from weaker growth, a decline in the value of key mining exports and the need for additional spending in some areas, Treasurer Jim Chalmers said ahead of a budget update.】

item.title: 英国正式加入 CPTPP 贸易协定
item.description: 英国商业和贸易部周日发布消息称，英国已加入《跨太平洋伙伴关系全面进步协议》。【原文：The UK has joined the Comprehensive and Progressive Agreement for Trans-Pacific Partnership, according to a release on Sunday from the country’s Department for Business and Trade.】

item.title: 强势美元、特朗普风险左右亚洲投资者 2025 年的最大赌注
item.description: 全球基金正在探索融合新旧经济的方法，以保护其在 2025 年的亚洲投资免受不确定的美国贸易政策和强势美元的挑战。【原文：Global funds are exploring ways to blend the new economy and the old to shield their Asian investments in 2025 from the challenges of uncertain US trade policies and a strong dollar.】

item.title: 安桥输油管道称威斯康星州漏油清理工作正在进行中
item.description: Enbridge 公司周六表示，11 月 11 日在威斯康星州泄漏的 960 桶石油中的 60% 已被清理，受影响的土壤正在被清除。【原文：Enbridge Inc. said Saturday that 60% of the 960 barrels of oil that were spilled on Nov. 11 in Wisconsin has been cleaned up and any affected soil is being removed.】

item.title: 罗得岛社会服务门户网站遭网络犯罪分子入侵
item.description: 罗得岛州一个管理公共福利的计算机系统被黑客入侵，黑客威胁说，除非收到付款，否则将公开个人数据。【原文：A Rhode Island computer system for managing public benefits was breached by hackers who have threatened to release personal data unless they receive a payment.】

item.title: 24小时降息结束全球央行宽松政策年
item.description: 这一年，大多数发达经济体的通胀率下降到足以开始放宽货币政策的程度，而这一年即将结束，美联储将在 24 小时内做出一系列决定。【原文：A year when inflation subsided enough for monetary policy easing to start in most advanced economies is about to conclude with a 24-hour flurry of decisions led by the Federal Reserve.】

item.title: 苏里南称石油特许权使用费支付将改善税务部门
item.description: 苏里南财政部长斯坦利-拉格霍巴辛（Stanley Raghoebarsing）表示，政府将只向已在税务系统登记的居民支付石油特许权使用费，以此减少未征税或未受监管的经济部门。【原文：Suriname’s Finance Minister Stanley Raghoebarsing said the government will pay oil royalties only to residents who have registered in the tax system as a way to reduce segments of the economy that aren’t taxed or subject to regulations.】

item.title: 区域性银行开始出现办公楼物业危机
item.description: 写字楼物业价值的下滑正在波及美国各家银行，尤其是较小的贷款机构在其商业房地产账簿中加大了贷款修改的使用力度。【原文：Slumping office property values are rippling through US banks, with smaller lenders in particular ramping up the use of loan modifications in their commercial real estate books.】

item.title: Stonepeak 接近达成凯雷 15 亿欧元收购 Forgital 的交易
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，Stonepeak 公司已达成收购 Forgital 集团的协议。【原文：Stonepeak has reached a deal to acquire Forgital Group, an Italian manufacturer of forged components mainly for the aerospace sector, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: TikTok 老鹰被选中工作与特朗普的模糊立场形成鲜明对比
item.description: 美国对 TikTok 批评最激烈的一些人将在下一届特朗普政府中担任高级职务，在 TikTok 面临美国禁令之际，为即将上任的总统对这款中国人拥有的流行应用程序的新开放态度提供抗衡力量。【原文：Some of the loudest US critics of TikTok are set to occupy senior roles in the next Trump administration, providing counterweights to the incoming president’s newfound openness to the popular Chinese-owned app as it faces an American ban.】

item.title: 缅怀环球旅行家大卫-邦德曼（David Bonderman）：问与答
item.description: 私募股权投资行业不乏大人物，但很少有人比大卫-邦德曼（David Bonderman）更大人物，他本周去世，享年 82 岁。【原文：The private equity industry has no shortage of outsize characters — but few were bigger than David Bonderman, who died this week at the age of 82.】

item.title: 马克-里奇的前避风港如何让顶级大宗商品交易员接受审判
item.description: 上周，当 Trafigura 集团董事马克-欧文（Mark Irwin）站起来在瑞士刑事法庭上作证时，这代表着世界大宗商品贸易商与他们中许多人的祖国之间关系的关键时刻。【原文：When Trafigura Group director Mark Irwin stood up last week to give evidence in a Swiss criminal court, it represented a pivotal moment in the relationship between the world’s commodity traders and the country that many of them call home.】

item.title: 赞比亚在债务重组交易前向中国支付 8,200 万美元
item.description: 赞比亚财政部表示，赞比亚国家电力公司在与其官方双边债权人达成债务重组协议之前，向中国进出口银行支付了 8200 万美元。【原文：Zambia’s state power utility made an $82 million payment to the Export-Import Bank of China before reaching a debt restructuring deal with its official bilateral creditors, the African nation’s finance ministry said.】

item.title: 购物中心、教育和退休生活的新起点
item.description:
本周我们深入探讨了美国购物中心的命运、老年住房短缺以及当选总统特朗普提高联邦政府效率的计划。【原文：

This week we delved into the fate of US shopping malls, a shortage of senior housing and President-elect Trump’s plans to bring greater efficiency to the federal government.

】

item.title: 俄罗斯首富认为卢布对美元汇率在 100-110 之间 "合理
item.description: 俄罗斯首富弗拉基米尔-波塔宁（Vladimir Potanin）周六表示，1 美元兑 100 至 110 卢布的汇率是 "合理的"，因为它平衡了国家和出口商的利益。【原文：An exchange rate of 100 to 110 rubles per US dollar is “reasonable” as it balances the interests of the state and exporters, Vladimir Potanin, Russia’s richest man, said on Saturday.】
